universum.studios.android.transition

Class Scale

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.transition.Transition
      • android.transition.Visibility
        • universum.studios.android.transition.Scale
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class Scale
extends android.transition.Visibility
    A Visibility transition implementation that tracks changes to the visibility of target views in the start and end scenes and scales up or down views in the scene. Visibility is determined by both the View.setVisibility(int) state of the view as well as whether it is parented in the current view hierarchy. Disappearing Views are limited as described in Visibility.onDisappear(android.view.ViewGroup, TransitionValues, int, TransitionValues, int).

    Scaling pivot for both X and Y axes, as concrete positions, may be specified via setPivotX(Float) and setPivotY(Float). In order too specify X and Y pivots as relative positions/fractions, setPivotXFraction(float) along with setPivotYFraction(float) may be used.

    Scale transition can be described in a resource file by using the transition tag with class attribute set to universum.studios.android.transition.Scale, along with Xml attributes referenced below.

    XML attributes

    Scale Attributes
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Method Detail

      • createAnimator

        @Nullable
public static android.animation.Animator createAnimator(@NonNull
                                                                   android.view.View view,
                                                                   float startScale,
                                                                   float endScale)
        Creates a new instance of Animator that animates both, scale X and scale Y, properties of the specified view.

        The returned animator will also have the default INTERPOLATOR attached.

        Parameters:
        view - The view for which to create the requested animator.
        startScale - Scale from which to start the animation along X and Y axis.
        endScale - Scale at which should the animation end along X and Y axis.
        Returns:
        Animator that will play scale animation for the specified view according to the specified parameters when started or null if the start and end scale values are the same.
        See Also:
        createAnimator(View, float, float, float, float)

      • createAnimator

        @Nullable
public static android.animation.Animator createAnimator(@NonNull
                                                                   android.view.View view,
                                                                   float startScaleX,
                                                                   float startScaleY,
                                                                   float endScaleX,
                                                                   float endScaleY)
        Creates a new instance of Animator that animates both, scale X and scale Y, properties of the specified view.

        The returned animator will also have the default INTERPOLATOR attached.

        Parameters:
        view - The view for which to create the requested animator.
        startScaleX - Scale from which to start the animation along X axis.
        startScaleY - Scale from which to start the animation along Y axis.
        endScaleX - Scale at which should the animation end along X axis.
        endScaleY - Scale at which should the animation end along Y axis.
        Returns:
        Animator that will play scale animation for the specified view according to the specified parameters when started or null if the start and end scale values are the same or the target view is already detached from window.

      • setPivotX

        public void setPivotX(@Nullable
                      Float pivotX)
        Sets a pivot x coordinate for scale animation.

        Default value: null

        Parameters:
        pivotX - The desired pivot x coordinate in pixels. May be null to use pivot fraction specified via setPivotXFraction(float) instead.
        See Also:
        getPivotX(), setPivotXFraction(float), setPivotY(Float), android:transformPivotX

      • getPivotX

        @Nullable
public Float getPivotX()
        Returns the x coordinate for pivot of the scale animation.
        Returns:
        Pivot in pixels or null if no pivot has been specified.
        See Also:
        setPivotX(Float)

      • setPivotY

        public void setPivotY(@Nullable
                      Float pivotY)
        Sets a pivot y coordinate for scale animation.

        Default value: null

        Parameters:
        pivotY - The desired pivot y coordinate in pixels. May be null to use pivot fraction specified via setPivotYFraction(float) instead.
        See Also:
        getPivotY(), setPivotYFraction(float), setPivotX(Float), android:transformPivotY

      • getPivotY

        @Nullable
public Float getPivotY()

        Pivot in pixels or null if no pivot has been specified.
        See Also:
        setPivotY(Float)

      • setPivotXFraction

        public void setPivotXFraction(float fractionX)
        Sets a fraction for the pivot x coordinate. This fraction will be used to resolve pivot x coordinate of an animating view depending on its current width if such value has not been specified via setPivotX(Float).

        Default value: 0.5

        Parameters:
        fractionX - The desired fraction from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        See Also:
        getPivotYFraction(), setPivotXFraction(float), setPivotX(Float), android:pivotX

      • getPivotXFraction

        public float getPivotXFraction()
        Returns the fraction of the pivot x coordinate.
        Returns:
        Fraction from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        See Also:
        setPivotXFraction(float)

      • setPivotYFraction

        public void setPivotYFraction(float fractionY)
        Sets a fraction for the pivot y coordinate. This fraction will be used to resolve pivot y coordinate of an animating view depending on its current height if such value has not been specified via setPivotY(Float).

        Default value: 0.5

        Parameters:
        fractionY - The desired fraction from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        See Also:
        getPivotXFraction(), setPivotYFraction(float), setPivotY(Float), android:pivotY

      • getPivotYFraction

        public float getPivotYFraction()
        Returns the fraction of the pivot y coordinate.
        Returns:
        Fraction from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        See Also:
        setPivotYFraction(float)
